module.description:
AUX Event Controller (AUX_EVCTL) assembles events originating from: - AUX submodules, including ADC and comparators. - AUXIO. - EVENT. - AON_PMCTL. - AON_RTC. - AON_BATMON.
into two 64-bit event buses. One is synchronized to the AUX clock and one is left unsynchronized.
The subscribers to the synchronous event bus are AUX_TIMER01, AUX_SCE and AUX_EVCTL. The subscribers to the asynchronous event bus are AUX_TIMER2, AUX_ANAIF, AUX_TDC and AUX_SYSIF.
AUX_EVCTL uses the synchronous event bus to generate events to AON_EVENT and EVENT, as well as to AUX_SCE. AUX_SCE can poll event status registers and combine certain instructions like WEV0, WEV1 with one or two configurable events. The latter saves power when execution must stall until a condition is met.

register.description:
Event Status 0
Register holds events 0 thru 15 of the 64-bit event bus that is synchronous to AUX clock. All events read through this register are synchronized at SCE clock rate, unless otherwise noted. The following subscribers use the asynchronous version of events in this register. - AUX_TIMER2. - AUX_ANAIF. - AUX_TDC. - AUX_SYSIF. - AUX_AIODIOn. - EVOBSCFG.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
AUXIO15 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 7.
AUXIO14 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 6.
AUXIO13 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 5.
AUXIO12 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 4.
AUXIO11 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 3.
AUXIO10 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 2.
AUXIO9 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 1.
AUXIO8 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO1:GPIODIN bit 0.
AUXIO7 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 7.
AUXIO6 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 6.
AUXIO5 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 5.
AUXIO4 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 4.
AUXIO3 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 3.
AUXIO2 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 2.
AUXIO1 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 1.
AUXIO0 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO0:GPIODIN bit 0.

register.description:
Event Status 1
Register holds events 16 thru 31 of the 64-bit event bus that is synchronous to AUX clock. All events read through this register are synchronized at SCE clock rate, unless otherwise noted. The following subscribers use the asynchronous version of events in this register. - AUX_TIMER2. - AUX_ANAIF. - AUX_TDC. - AUX_SYSIF. - AUX_AIODIOn. - EVOBSCFG.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
AUXIO31 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 7.
AUXIO30 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 6.
AUXIO29 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 5.
AUXIO28 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 4.
AUXIO27 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 3.
AUXIO26 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 2.
AUXIO25 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 1.
AUXIO24 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO3:GPIODIN bit 0.
AUXIO23 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 7.
AUXIO22 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 6.
AUXIO21 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 5.
AUXIO20 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 4.
AUXIO19 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 3.
AUXIO18 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 2.
AUXIO17 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 1.
AUXIO16 pin level, read value corresponds to AUX_AIODIO2:GPIODIN bit 0.

register.description:
Event Status 2
Register holds events 32 thru 47 of the 64-bit event bus that is synchronous to AUX clock. All events read through this register are synchronized at SCE clock rate, unless otherwise noted. The following subscribers use the asynchronous version of events in this register. - AUX_TIMER2. - AUX_ANAIF. - AUX_TDC. - AUX_SYSIF. - AUX_AIODIOn. - EVOBSCFG.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Comparator B output. Configuration of AUX_SYSIF:EVSYNCRATE.AUX_COMPB_SYNC_RATE sets the synchronization rate for this event.
Comparator A output. Configuration of AUX_SYSIF:EVSYNCRATE.AUX_COMPA_SYNC_RATE sets the synchronization rate for this event.
Observation input 1 from IOC. This event is configured by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL1.
Observation input 0 from IOC. This event is configured by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL0 and can be overridden by IOC:OBSAUXOUTPUT.SEL_MISC.
Event from EVENT configured by EVENT:AUXSEL0.
TDC reference clock. It is configured by DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.ACLK_REF_SRC_SEL and enabled by AUX_SYSIF:TDCREFCLKCTL.REQ.
Event is high during VDDR recharge.
Event is high while system(MCU, AUX, or JTAG domains) is active or transitions to active (GLDO or DCDC power supply state). Event is not high during VDDR recharge.
Event is high while system(MCU, AUX, or JTAG domains) is in powerdown (uLDO power supply).
SCLK_LF clock
Event is high for two SCLK_MF clock periods when there is an update of AON_BATMON:TEMP.
Event is high for two SCLK_MF clock periods when there is an update of AON_BATMON:BAT.
AON_RTC:SUBSEC.VALUE bit 19. AON_RTC:CTL.RTC_4KHZ_EN enables this event.
AON_RTC:EVFLAGS.CH2 delayed by AON_RTC:CTL.EV_DELAY configuration.
AON_RTC:EVFLAGS.CH2.
Programmable event. See MANUAL for description.

register.description:
Event Status 3
Register holds events 48 thru 63 of the 64-bit event bus that is synchronous to AUX clock. All events read through this register are synchronized at SCE clock rate, unless otherwise noted. The following subscribers use the asynchronous version of events in this register. - AUX_TIMER2. - AUX_ANAIF. - AUX_TDC . - AUX_SYSIF. - AUX_AIODIOn. - EVOBSCFG.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
See AUX_SMPH:AUTOTAKE.SMPH_ID for description.
AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.EMPTY negated

The logical function for this event is configurable.
When DMACTL.EN = 1 : Event = UDMA0 Channel 7 done event OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.OVERFLOW OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.UNDERFLOW
When DMACTL.EN = 0 : Event = (NOT AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.EMPTY) OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.OVERFLOW OR AUX_ANAIF:ADCFIFOSTAT.UNDERFLOW
Bit 7 in UDMA0:DONEMASK must be 0.
AUX_ANAIF ADC conversion done event. Event is synchronized at AUX bus rate.
AUX_ANAIF:ISRCCTL.RESET_N
AUX_TDC:STAT.DONE
AUX_TIMER0_EV event, see AUX_TIMER01:T0TARGET for description.
AUX_TIMER1_EV event, see AUX_TIMER01:T1TARGET for description.
AUX_TIMER2 pulse event. Configuration of AUX_SYSIF:EVSYNCRATE.AUX_TIMER2_SYNC_RATE sets the synchronization rate for this event.
AUX_TIMER2 event output 3. Configuration of AUX_SYSIF:EVSYNCRATE.AUX_TIMER2_SYNC_RATE sets the synchronization rate for this event.
AUX_TIMER2 event output 2. Configuration of AUX_SYSIF:EVSYNCRATE.AUX_TIMER2_SYNC_RATE sets the synchronization rate for this event.
AUX_TIMER2 event output 1. Configuration of AUX_SYSIF:EVSYNCRATE.AUX_TIMER2_SYNC_RATE sets the synchronization rate for this event.
AUX_TIMER2 event output 0. Configuration of AUX_SYSIF:EVSYNCRATE.AUX_TIMER2_SYNC_RATE sets the synchronization rate for this event.

register.description:
Sensor Controller Engine Wait Event Configuration 0
Configuration of this register and SCEWEVCFG1 controls bit index 7 in AUX_SCE:WUSTAT.EV_SIGNALS. This bit can be used by AUX_SCE WEV0, WEV1, BEV0 and BEV1 instructions.
When COMB_EV_EN = 0: AUX_SCE:WUSTAT.EV_SIGNALS (7) = EV0_SEL event
When COMB_EV_EN = 1: AUX_SCE:WUSTAT.EV_SIGNALS (7) = ( EV0_SEL event ) OR ( SCEWEVCFG1.EV1_SEL event )
Bit fields SCEWEVCFG1.EV0_POL and SCEWEVCFG1.EV1_POL control the polarity of selected events.
Event combination is useful when there is a need to wait for a certain condition with timeout.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Event combination control:
0: Disable event combination. 1: Enable event combination.
Select the event source from the synchronous event bus to be used in event equation.

bitenum.token: Programmable delay event as described in PROGDLY
bitenum.description: Programmable delay event as described in PROGDLY

register.description:
Sensor Controller Engine Wait Event Configuration 1
See SCEWEVCFG0 for description.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Polarity of SCEWEVCFG0.EV0_SEL event.
When SCEWEVCFG0.COMB_EV_EN is 0:
0: Non-inverted. 1: Non-inverted.
When SCEWEVCFG0.COMB_EV_EN is 1.
0: Non-inverted. 1: Inverted.

Polarity of EV1_SEL event.
When SCEWEVCFG0.COMB_EV_EN is 0:
0: Non-inverted. 1: Non-inverted.
When SCEWEVCFG0.COMB_EV_EN is 1.
0: Non-inverted. 1: Inverted.
Select the event source from the synchronous event bus to be used in event equation.

bitenum.token: Programmable delay event as described in PROGDLY
bitenum.description: Programmable delay event as described in PROGDLY

register.description: Direct Memory Access Control

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
UDMA0 Request mode

bitenum.token: Single requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.
bitenum.description: Single requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.

bitenum.token: Burst requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.
bitenum.description: Burst requests are generated on UDMA0 channel 7 when the condition configured in SEL is met.

bitfield.description:
uDMA ADC interface enable.
0: Disable UDMA0 interface to ADC. 1: Enable UDMA0 interface to ADC.
Select FIFO watermark level required to trigger a UDMA0 transfer of ADC FIFO data.

bitenum.token: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when the ADC FIFO is almost full (3/4 full).
bitenum.description: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when the ADC FIFO is almost full (3/4 full).

bitenum.token: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when there are samples in the ADC FIFO.
bitenum.description: UDMA0 trigger event will be generated when there are samples in the ADC FIFO.

register.description:
Software Event Set
Set software event flags from AUX domain to AON and MCU domains. CPUs in MCU domain can read the event flags from EVTOAONFLAGS and clear them in EVTOAONFLAGSCLR.
Use of these event flags is software-defined.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Software event flag 2.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 2.

Software event flag 1.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 1.

Software event flag 0.
0: No effect. 1: Set software event flag 0.

register.description:
Events To AON Flags
This register contains a collection of event flags routed to AON_EVENT.
To clear an event flag, write to EVTOAONFLAGSCLR or write 0 to event flag in this register.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_TIMER1_EV occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER1_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_TIMER0_EV occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER0_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_TDC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TDC_DONE.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_ADC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_ADC_DONE.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_COMPB occurs on EVSTAT2.AUX_COMPB.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOAONPOL.AUX_COMPA occurs on EVSTAT2.AUX_COMPA.
This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV2.
This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV1.
This event flag is set when software writes a 1 to SWEVSET.SWEV0.

register.description:
Events To AON Polarity
Event source polarity configuration for EVTOAONFLAGS.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select the level of EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER1_EV that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_TIMER1_EV.
Select the level of EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER0_EV that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_TIMER0_EV.
Select level of EVSTAT3.AUX_TDC_DONE that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_TDC_DONE.
Select the level of EVSTAT3.AUX_ADC_DONE that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_ADC_DONE.
Select the edge of EVSTAT2.AUX_COMPB that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Select the edge of EVSTAT2.AUX_COMPA that sets EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description:
Events To AON Clear
Clear event flags in EVTOAONFLAGS.
In order to clear a level sensitive event flag, the event must be deasserted.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_TIMER1_EV.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_TIMER0_EV.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_TDC_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_ADC_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.SWEV2.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.SWEV1.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOAONFLAGS.SWEV0.
Read value is 0.

register.description:
Events to MCU Flags
This register contains a collection of event flags routed to MCU domain.
To clear an event flag, write to EVTOMCUFLAGSCLR or write 0 to event flag in this register. Follow procedure described in AUX_SYSIF:WUCLR to clear AUX_WU_EV event flag.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TIMER2_PULSE occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER2_PULSE.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TIMER2_EV3 occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER2_EV3.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TIMER2_EV2 occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER2_EV2.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TIMER2_EV1 occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER2_EV1.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TIMER2_EV0 occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER2_EV0.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_ADC_IRQ occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_ADC_IRQ.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.MCU_OBSMUX0 occurs on EVSTAT2.MCU_OBSMUX0.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_ADC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_ADC_DONE.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TIMER1_EV occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER1_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TIMER0_EV occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TIMER0_EV.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_TDC_DONE occurs on EVSTAT3.AUX_TDC_DONE.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_COMPB occurs on EVSTAT2.AUX_COMPB.
This event flag is set when edge selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_COMPA occurs on EVSTAT2.AUX_COMPA.
This event flag is set when level selected by EVTOMCUPOL.AUX_WU_EV occurs on reduction-OR of the AUX_SYSIF:WUFLAGS register.

register.description:
Event To MCU Polarity
Event source polarity configuration for EVTOMCUFLAGS.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_PULSE.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV3.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV2.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV1.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV0.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_ADC_IRQ.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.MCU_OBSMUX0.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_ADC_DONE.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER1_EV.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER0_EV.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TDC_DONE.
Select the event source edge that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Select the event source edge that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.
Select the event source level that sets EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_WU_EV.

register.description:
Events To MCU Flags Clear
Clear event flags in EVTOMCUFLAGS.
In order to clear a level sensitive event flag, the event must be deasserted.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_PULSE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV3.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_ADC_IRQ.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.MCU_OBSMUX0.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_ADC_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_ADC_DONE.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_SMPH_AUTOTAKE_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER1_EV.

Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TDC_DONE.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPB.
Read value is 0.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_COMPA.

Write 1 to clear EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_WU_EV.
Read value is 0.

register.description:
Combined Event To MCU Mask
Select event flags in EVTOMCUFLAGS that contribute to the AUX_COMB event to EVENT and system CPU.
The AUX_COMB event is high as long as one or more of the included event flags are set.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_PULSE contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV3 contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV2 contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_TIMER2_EV1 contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

0: Exclude. 1: Include.

EVTOMCUFLAGS.AUX_WU_EV contribution to the AUX_COMB event.
0: Exclude. 1: Include.

register.description: Event Observation Configuration

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select which event from the asynchronous event bus that represents AUX_EV_OBS in AUX_AIODIOn.

register.description: Programmable Delay

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

VALUE decrements to 0 at a rate of 1 MHz.
The event AUX_PROG_DLY_IDLE is high when VALUE is 0, otherwise it is low.
Only use the programmable delay counter and the AUX_PROG_DLY_IDLE event when AUX_SYSIF:OPMODEACK.ACK equals A or LP.
Decrementation of VALUE halts when either is true: - AUX_SCE:CTL.DBG_FREEZE_EN is set and system CPU is halted in debug mode. - AUX_SYSIF:TIMERHALT.PROGDLY is set.

register.description:
Manual
Programmable event.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This bit field sets the value of EVSTAT2.MANUAL_EV.

register.description: Event Status 0 Low

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Alias of EVSTAT0 event 7 down to 0.

register.description: Event Status 0 High

register.description: Event Status 3 High

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Alias of EVSTAT3 event 15 down to 8.
